page.title: 05The Bede House,Lyddington
page.content: The building now owned by the Heritage Trust,was originally erected as a res- idence for the Bishops of Lincoln and is recorded as such as early as the reign of King John.The existing build- ing is mostly of a later period and consists of a 15th century range which has been altered by later Bishops. After the Reformation it passed into lay hands and in 1602 Thos. Lord Burghley founded the Bede House or Alm shouse which was in use up to the present century.The building is of honey coloured limestone with darker stone dressings and a Collyweston slate roof.The ceiling of the main floor is beautifully carved giving the appearance of fan vaulting.Part of the building was divided into small rooms for the bedesmen.An octagonal turreted gazebo at the S.W.corner has an open passage for pedestrians.
